org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain

Class Chunks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain.Chunks

  • public class Chunks
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages terrain and corruption generation, updating, optimising and rendering. Both terrain and corruption are rendered as direct OpenGL draw calls with their own vertex and index buffers that get uploaded to the GPU. They are also rendered using custom GLSL shaders
    See Also:
    Shaders

      • updateView

        public void updateView(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera cam)
        Updates section camera culling and updates sections that got into the camera view and aren't updated yet. This method has a inbuilt polling feature that prevents unnecessary view updates. The rate is defined by pollRate.
        Parameters:
        cam - The main game camera

      • updateSectionMesh

        public void updateSectionMesh(Section s,
                              boolean corr)
        Updates terrain or corruption meshes of the section, if corr == true, corruption mesh of a selected layer will be updated If layer == -1, all corruption meshes of the section will be updated
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section
        corr - Whether a terrain or corruption mesh should be updated

      • updateAllSectionMeshes

        public void updateAllSectionMeshes(boolean corr)
        Updates terrain or corruption meshes of all the sections in main camera view, if corr == true, corruption mesh will be updated.
        Parameters:
        corr - Whether a terrain or corruption mesh should be updated

      • updateAllSectionMeshes

        public void updateAllSectionMeshes(boolean corr,
                                   boolean theWholeMap)
        Updates terrain or corruption meshes of all the sections in main camera view, if corr == true, corruption mesh will be updated. TheWholeMap boolean states whether to only update sectionsInView or the whole sections array, eg. every Section on the map.
        Parameters:
        corr - Whether a terrain or corruption mesh should be updated
        theWholeMap - Whether all the sections in the world should be updated. If false this method behaves like updateAllSectionMeshes(boolean)
        See Also:
        updateAllSectionMeshes(boolean)

      • drawTerrain

        public void drawTerrain()

      • drawCorruption

        public void drawCorruption()
        Draws the Section.corrMesh of every Section in the sectionsInView list. Corruption is drawn as a textured grid rendered using the OpenGL GL_TRIANGLES primitive and a custom glsl corruption shader (Shaders).
        Since:
        As of the version v5.0 (30.11.2018). Corruption and its edge resolving operates in a single mesh. Before, there were separate meshes for every corruption layer. That allowed me to tint different layers a specific shade. I've overcome this need by using a glsl shader that blends textures together. Thus I didn't need to keep corruption layers as separate meshes but as a single mesh (per Section) which increases performance.
        See Also:
        Chunk.getCorruptionTexture()

      • drawFogOfWar

        public void drawFogOfWar()

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility(float x,
                          float y,
                          int radius,
                          Chunks.Visibility visibility)
        Changes the fog of war visibility around an origin (in world space coordinates) and sets the appropriate visibility in the surrounding circular radius (in tiles). The radius cannot be more than 2*Base.SECTION_SIZE, because only the current, and neighbouring Sections are updated! TODO: improve.
        Parameters:
        x - Origin x world space coordinate.
        y - Origin y world space coordinate.
        radius - The radius of the circle, in tiles.
        visibility - Type of visibility.

      • generateFogOfWarMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh generateFogOfWarMesh(Section s)
        Generates the fog of war Mesh for the specified Section. The generated mesh uses GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP and degenerate triangles at the end of rows.
        Parameters:
        s - The mesh section.
        Returns:
        The generated Mesh.

      • generateFogOfWarMeshVertexData

        public MeshVertexData generateFogOfWarMeshVertexData(Section s,
                                                     int sizeX,
                                                     int sizeY)
        Generates the fog of war MeshVertexData for the specified Section. The generated mesh uses GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP and degenerate triangles at the end of rows.
        Parameters:
        s - The mesh section.
        Returns:
        The generated MeshVertexData.

      • generateMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh generateMesh(Section s,
                                                   boolean corr)
        Generates and initialises a terrain or a corruption mesh. Should be only called once and the initialised mesh than can get updated using the the generateMeshVertexData(Section, boolean) method.
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should be generated
        Returns:
        Returns the generated Mesh object

      • generateMeshVertexData

        public MeshVertexData generateMeshVertexData(Section s,
                                             boolean corr)
        Returns an updated MeshVertexData object used to update the Section meshes.
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should be generated
        Returns:
        Updated MeshVertexData object.

      • generateVertexArrays

        private MeshVertexData generateVertexArrays(Section s,
                                            boolean corr,
                                            int numberOfRectangles,
                                            int numberOfVertices)
        Generates the vertices and indices arrays for a Mesh with 13 vertex attributes
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should b e generated
        numberOfRectangles - Number of rectangles in the vertex array
        numberOfVertices - Number of vertices in the vertex array
        Returns:
        Updated MeshVertexData object.

      • setValuesInArrayForVertex

        private void setValuesInArrayForVertex(float[] vertices,
                                       float au,
                                       float av,
                                       float bu,
                                       float bv,
                                       float cu,
                                       float cv,
                                       float du,
                                       float dv,
                                       float x,
                                       float y,
                                       float c,
                                       float shade,
                                       float shade1,
                                       int rectangleOffsetInArray,
                                       int vertexNumberInRect)
        Method that populates the mesh vertex array (OpenGL VBO)
        Parameters:
        vertices - The array that is being modified
        au - U texture1 coordinate
        av - V texture1 coordinate
        bu - U texture2 coordinate
        bv - V texture2 coordinate
        cu - U texture3 coordinate
        cv - V texture3 coordinate
        du - U texture4 coordinate
        dv - V texture4 coordinate
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        c - The packed color that can be used with shaders
        shade - A special shade attribute represented as "a_shade" in shaders and which is used to tint corruption mesh tiles
        rectangeOffsetInArray - Index of the current position in the array
        vertexNumberInRect - Rectangle (tile) vertex which attributes are being set

      • generateAll

        public TextureContainer generateAll()
        Generates the terrain relief and ores.
        Returns:
        Returns a TextureContainer that holds gray-scale pixmaps of generated maps.
        Textures are in the following order: 1. terrain height map, 2. coal map, 3. iron map. This method has to be called after create().

      • getChunksAroundWorldSpacePoint

        public java.util.List<Chunk> getChunksAroundWorldSpacePoint(float x,
                                                            float y,
                                                            float diameter,
                                                            ChunkOperation o)
        Gets the chunks around the world space point in a certain diameter (diameter is in tile space).
        Parameters:
        x - Center X coordinate.
        y - Center Y coordinate.
        diameter - Diameter of the selection.
        o - ChunkOperation to be executed for each Chunk.
        Returns:
        A list of all selected Chunks.
